Posts.Content: The side effects are what they use as fillers ..please go back to your GP and demand the original patent of tamoxifen ...I am on femera ( patent ) more commonly known as  letrozole ...my drug costs £80/£90 a month and the other cheap generics cost £3/£4 a month ..that kind of says it all !! A lot of the drugs are made in India and China and come under different regulations so even requesting a European generic is better ...I've just had a month off ..I also take cod liver oil and turmeric each day ...hope this helps  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Aching joints

Posts.Content: Yes it's all about the cost ...once femera is on your prescription they have to by law supply it ..it's not perfect as I have the odd bad days but it's better than most ...you just have to be pushy and threaten to go to your ccg to complain  Good luck if I can help at all message me  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Aching joints

Posts.Content: Hi Zen  Moan away it does you good....look at my rant its not just information its communication as well!!  Hugs and rainbows sent your way  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Paying for Letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi limbo 1977  just to add on to what others have said ...it's hard to carry on "normally"I was diagnosed 7th December and my partner had booked Barcelona for Xmas ..we were told to go and enjoy ..it would make no difference ..in my head it was growing and taking over my body ...reality it didn't make any difference and we had a bloody fantastic time and got engaged on Xmas day ( he'd planned it since September lol) ...op 5th Jan..grade 3 18mm er+pr+her-....had oncotype Dx test to see if I needed chemo so another two weeks waiting ....I think you'll find the waiting is the worse ..once you have a plan for treatment it gives you focus ...here is a good place to be ..we laugh we cry we shout we rant but whenever your low someone here will always lift you up ...good luck it's one hell of a roller coaster ride but you can do it ..be strong and kick the shit out of cancer  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results....... I'll be around for a while

Posts.Content: Hi Karen  Any diagnosis of cancer you automatically get free prescriptions...I'm on tamoxifen "Tom" as we call him cos of the moods swings lol Good luck  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Paying for Letrozole

Posts.Content: I was lucky enough to be offered the oncotype Dx test which resulted in me not having chemotherapy so I cannot help with advice but I just wanted to wish your sister good luck and make sure you stay well too ! I had a very difficult time earlier this year ( diagnosed December 2016)...I can't tell you enough how wonderful the online community were and are ...the support I got at every hour of the day was just fantastic ...the care and the knowledge is just wonderful and it made me stronger ...I'm now a patient ambassador for Macmillan and trust me it's not that long ago I was in a lonely dark place and a mess !! There is light and each day your sister will get closer to it  Lots of hugs and rainbows to you both Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: My sister. needs postive messages from people who are in the same...

Posts.Content: Great news!! Get  the R1 and R2 ready ..its really good  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Post surgery path report

Posts.Content: I'm slowly joining the hot sweaty club lol ..I've got a chill pillow and find that it does help( Amazon)  ...when I see my Doc I'm deffo going to ask about magnesium levels and also k2 which seems to get rid of joint ache ....read quite a bit as making informed decision regarding meds in next week or so  Hugs ( not sweaty ones lol) and Rainbows Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Magnesium for hot flushes

Posts.Content: I'm slowly joining the hot sweaty club lol ..I've got a chill pillow and find that it does help( Amazon)  ...when I see my Doc I'm deffo going to ask about magnesium levels and also k2 which seems to get rid of joint ache ....read quite a bit as making informed decision regarding meds in next week or so  Hugs ( not sweaty ones lol) and Rainbows Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Magnesium for hot flushes

Posts.Content: Lol love it ....it would be my Chris's worse nightmare lol ...one thing is good he's always cold so I use him as a chill pillow as well lol Hugs to you as always I had a beautiful rainbow earlier  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Magnesium for hot flushes

Posts.Content: Lol love it ....it would be my Chris's worse nightmare lol ...one thing is good he's always cold so I use him as a chill pillow as well lol Hugs to you as always I had a beautiful rainbow earlier  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Magnesium for hot flushes

Posts.Content: Hi Sally  That's great advice and I've not had a mastectomy but lots of shrinkage and problems with scarring and seroma so I have a knitted knocker its light fun and does the job......there is a UK site....I took out some of the stuffing and it's so comfy...maybe worth a look  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: I finally found a comfy bra:)

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki  I was exactly the same and couldn't shift that physical nausea and fear ...how do you get to results day ? One day at a time ...focus on doing something with the kids each day ...feeding the ducks ..a picnic ( probs in the rain lol)but they love it ...it will take your mind off for a short time and also some routine whilst off for the Summer ....you will get there and most will tell you it's the waiting which is worse ...I felt like each day the monster was growing ..our imagination can be so cruel ..try and see it in a positive way ...they've found it and are going to treat it and the treatment is so fast moving you will be getting the best that's out there ...don't do dr Google too much rubbish out there ...I know easier said than done ! Keep to here /cancer research ..well known sites , the group on here is just awesome and there is a group for younger women too ..join both ...we are here every step of the way .. Lots of hugs and rainbows  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: New diagnosis - feel like I'm living a nightmare

Posts.Content: Rebel ..I like that lol and it has to work around your lifestyle ...I was prescribed by the oncologist ...one thing I did was make an appointment with my GP to go through everything and be  clear what I want on my prescriptions ... hope this helps xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Rebel ..I like that lol and it has to work around your lifestyle ...I was prescribed by the oncologist ...one thing I did was make an appointment with my GP to go through everything and be  clear what I want on my prescriptions ... hope this helps xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Yes deffo as he combined my vitD and calcium which I'm still taking also what make of tamoxifen have you got ? It took three days to get the Wockhardt ones with the GP putting the make on my prescription ...my GP is great hope yours is too ...it helps having a nurse who has breast cancer 15 years ago cos when she found out it was a case of what do you want we will get it ie R1and R2 ...nothing so far has been any trouble but I know that's not the same for everyone  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxX
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi Louby 123 ive been on tamoxifen since 7th Feb so early days ...I do take it an hour after my evening meal so works through the night ....some hot flushes but ok ...it's more the mood swings we call it "Tom" ..Chris my partner says toms out and mostly we laugh 90% of the time the other 10% he either runs for the hills or our local pub lol !!! I was put on vitD and calcium straight away stick to the same make as sometimes the cheaper ones it's the fillers they put in cause problems I'm on Wockhardt which so far is good  there's lots of lovely ladies on here with much more wealth of knowledge than me and they will help you of that I'm sure  good luck Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: It makes me sooo cross!!! We go through enough then to be blocked by ignorance  Please insist on the make you want I did and luckily I have a great GP who totally agreed it was the chemist I had problems with at first  It's your body and you can Deffo insist on what make...its all down to money and where the pharmacist buys them from especially if a chain of them...I told mine I'd go to another chemist...funny enough three days later my Wockhardt arrived from Scotland ( im in Lancs)  He moaned and yet the cheap generic ones where from France!!!  Sorry rant over....God we go through so.many battles on this journey don't we!   Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi Louby 123 ive been on tamoxifen since 7th Feb so early days ...I do take it an hour after my evening meal so works through the night ....some hot flushes but ok ...it's more the mood swings we call it "Tom" ..Chris my partner says toms out and mostly we laugh 90% of the time the other 10% he either runs for the hills or our local pub lol !!! I was put on vitD and calcium straight away stick to the same make as sometimes the cheaper ones it's the fillers they put in cause problems I'm on Wockhardt which so far is good  there's lots of lovely ladies on here with much more wealth of knowledge than me and they will help you of that I'm sure  good luck Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi Louby123 I think it's one of the originals but as you can see we all react differently....I do know that when the oncologist was doing the prescription I mentioned about cheap generic ones and he threw the first printed prescription in the bin and went back on the computer and gave me Wockhardt.....I also have problems sleeping but that developed last year ( total knee replacement ) so I take a prescribed type of nytol which really helps  It's very much trial and error...hot flushes doable....have got a cool pillow for night time  Hope this helps  Rainbow Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi Louby123 I think it's one of the originals but as you can see we all react differently....I do know that when the oncologist was doing the prescription I mentioned about cheap generic ones and he threw the first printed prescription in the bin and went back on the computer and gave me Wockhardt.....I also have problems sleeping but that developed last year ( total knee replacement ) so I take a prescribed type of nytol which really helps  It's very much trial and error...hot flushes doable....have got a cool pillow for night time  Hope this helps  Rainbow Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: I should have also added when I had my op I had 3 sentinel nodes and 10 that the surgeon said were palpable which indicated cancer present ...they were negative ..as someone has already said these are the soldiers stopping it going elsewhere...I had a knee replacement last year so my sleep pattern was already shot ..I'm the least likely person to meditate but I found a site called fragrant heart.com...there are free audios for alsorts ...she has some for cancer which I found good and the chronic pain always gets me to sleep better than the sleep ones lol ...it's worth a peep ...helps you focus ...this roller coaster lasts a while ...coming to terms with this just takes time ..the Macmillan helpline is also really good, thinking of you and your family  And optimistic please check out the HOPE course  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: New diagnosis - feel like I'm living a nightmare

Posts.Content: Yes deffo as he combined my vitD and calcium which I'm still taking also what make of tamoxifen have you got ? It took three days to get the Wockhardt ones with the GP putting the make on my prescription ...my GP is great hope yours is too ...it helps having a nurse who has breast cancer 15 years ago cos when she found out it was a case of what do you want we will get it ie R1and R2 ...nothing so far has been any trouble but I know that's not the same for everyone  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxX
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: It makes me sooo cross!!! We go through enough then to be blocked by ignorance  Please insist on the make you want I did and luckily I have a great GP who totally agreed it was the chemist I had problems with at first  It's your body and you can Deffo insist on what make...its all down to money and where the pharmacist buys them from especially if a chain of them...I told mine I'd go to another chemist...funny enough three days later my Wockhardt arrived from Scotland ( im in Lancs)  He moaned and yet the cheap generic ones where from France!!!  Sorry rant over....God we go through so.many battles on this journey don't we!   Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi Shartom  Welcome to our lively group ...I had a seroma that burst through the wound ( think alien lol )a week after my op  ...is the fluid clear and  decreasing each time ? Mine carried on for three months and then started to settle ...a tip that I use everyday to get the lymphatic system moving is to use a long handled body brush and brush all over always to the heart ...my surgeon said that its friendly fluid working overtime !! I also wore tight sports bras and think this helped as well ....you will get there  Never give up....Never give in  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: I still have a large seroma 5 months after my surgery

Posts.Content: It must be very frustrating for you ...are you managing to do any exercises ? I'm not sure if this helps but I had a drain for a few days so the fluid didn't build up ...I wore dressings ( mepilex) very soft on the skin ...they were reluctant at first re infection but it did work ..sorry can't be more help  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: I still have a large seroma 5 months after my surgery

Posts.Content: You can insist with your GP which one you want ..I am lucky that I have a great GP who totally agreed that if I'm taking something for 10 years I want my body to get the best ...we go through enough and the professionals are aware but it's not them it's happenning to ...I've been asked to be a Patient Ambassador and hopefully be involved in discussions with NHS providers ...I've also joined my local CCG ..who in your area hold the purse strings it's worth emailing them ..the more they hear they will eventually have to listen and in the long run its false economy ...one dearer tablet is better than several to stop the side effects of the fillers !!! Madness lol ... Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi  Sorry only just replying  Ccg in your area holds all the purse strings and in my area cut every form of support for breast cancer just google ccg and your area  I'm a patient ambassador for Macmillan ..if you phone the main Nos on here they will give you lots of information obtainable locally and any local support group and also any courses running that could help  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi I'm really glad it sounds like you've finally found people who understand.....I am on tamoxifen as issued letrozole first then the blood test came back I'm peri menopausal so now on tamoxifen.....one tip is after having the same problem as you even when my lovely GP had put the brand on the prescription...I order my tablets with a months supply left....no excuses now lol....it is ALWAYS about cost!! And deffo right I dont care anymore who I upset its my body not there's and mostly assertive but on getting the cheap generics its amazing what a good cry can do....even other customers were saying how you shouldn't have to fight for a drug you are going to take for a long time  Good luck you're deffo on the right track now  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: supply of letrozole

Posts.Content: Thanks London Lass for the advice and my lovely moving pic ...I've written everything down hopefully ....just not sure what the appointment entails as I have the radiologist oncologist in two weeks ...how do I get the pic ?  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Oncologist follow up appointment

Posts.Content: Hi Suzeanna  thank you for your reply and good luck tomorrow ....this is my first after treatment and been on tamoxifen for three months ...now written loads of questions !! ill be using all my appointment time up that's for sure !!  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Oncologist follow up appointment

Posts.Content: I've been on femara since June and so far only get stiff when sitting for a while ...I read on here taking glucosamine sulphate helps and my GP agreed even though my magnesium was normal ..there was a discussion on here with a lady who suffered terrible joint pain and after taking this it cleared within two weeks ...hope this helps and your back pain clears soon  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara and back pain?

Posts.Content: hi all the lovely people on here ...happy Wednesday !!  I would love some advice as I have my first oncology appointment post radiotherapy tomorrow morning and have been on tamoxifen since 7th February .what questions should I be asking ? I have a few but the advice on here is always fantastic ...one concern is the lymphovascular invasion which I was told is not important but it keeps itching at the back of my mind ..thank you in anticipation  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Oncologist follow up appointment

Posts.Content: I've given up with the pics...they never load up lol.....Sat as Chris (partner) runs a bath for me..there are some pluses...lol....not many ...but most of all the great people in our club...how strong we are even on our bad days... Attitude is a little thing that makes a BIG difference  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype Result Advice please - part two THANKS EVERYONE

Posts.Content: That's a lovely message...let me know how you get on...ask them to use the other recurrence tests sorry I can't remember the name....look at the whole picture and I agree it's got to be your decision and one that you would look back and not change  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype Result Advice please - part two THANKS EVERYONE

Posts.Content: lots of great advice so far ...my boss was disciplining me in Decenber and waited to tell me she was dropping it two days after my diagnosis  ( on my birthday ) it was over 15 mins we argued about a break !!  Firstly we are all now covered by the equality act and are now 'disabled' it covers us an awful lot ...what we all need is to walk around with our arms in a sling ...colleagues ask how you are etc ...I worked till 1.30pm and went for radiotherapy at 3pm for four weeks in March ..one colleague actually forgot I was having radiotherapy but in a nice way ...,I work in an sebd school and the kids know why I was off and then having radiotherapy ...reasonable adjustments can be made mine was extra breaks ...and when the fatigue hit I've reduced my hours again ...be assertive and don't push yourself too much ...the trouble is its known as the walking well disease ...I had more sympathy with my knee replacement last year !!!  Its finding what's right for you accepting you are knackered and will take time to recover  good luck in returning ...leave lots of booklets around as a reminder it works Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Back to work anxiety

Posts.Content: Sorry you are having problems and I'm sure there will somebody along who is much more knowledgable ..I had a wle but developed a large seroma and cording ...I did the exercises and also used and still do a long handled body brush always brushing to the heart ....I went to a pantomime a week after op and clapped too much and burst my wound which was very scary at the time ...my breast surgeon who stitched me up said you need to think of it as "friendly fluid" and this will be a distant memory in 6/8 weeks ..I thought rubbish lol but he was right !! It's very important to do the exercises especially for cording and when you move onto radiotherapy ...good luck with all your treatment ...the support here is so fantastic ... Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Seroma advice please

Posts.Content: I worked through rt and it was as if ...what's your problem you've finished treatment afterwards ..fatigue ? We've all got that lol  ...I would have had more sympathy if I had my arm in a sling !!  People are scared of cancer ..aren't we all ...I talk about it all the time ...it's good to make people uncomfortable ..they will all be touched in one way or another !!  Never give up  Never give in  Hugs and Rainbows to everyone  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Annoyed!!!!!

Posts.Content: I can help regarding the oncotype dx test...you have to reach a certain criteria and if your husband does they will automatically send it off....I was told when getting my post op  results and had never heard of it....start a diary and keep a separate page for questions I found they came to me at odd times like the middle of the night lol  You should have no difficulty getting copies as they can just print them off there and then for you...insist it is your right.... I hope that helps a little...the support on here is beyond fab  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Decisions to make, all so overwhelming

Posts.Content: Hi Angie  That's great news...woohoo!!! I'm on tamoxifen...a tip I got is to take it an hour after your evening meal and so far a few hot flushes but doable....mood swings though meet "Tom" as my partner has named it lol...most of the time if he tells me Toms out I laugh and reel me neck back in but when that doesn't work he runs for the hills...or realistically takes the.dogs around the.block and calls in for a pint!!! Win win situation..its mad with this awful journey but seems find laughing helps a lot  Warm hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx  Oh and the tip about the make is great too...I'm on Wockhardt which is a good make they tried to give me cheaper ones...not a chance make sure your GP puts the make on the prescription xx
Posts.Title: Decisions to make, all so overwhelming

Posts.Content: Hi Angie Sorry for your dilemma and totally understand where you are coming from....the advice given is spot on but I got bogged down with statistics....to have chemo I'd gain 0.03% life expectancy...what does that mean???  A lovely lady on here was in a.dilemma about chemo..I chatted with my dad about statistics...his answer "b****x" lol...he's 91 this year 10 strokes a very heavy smoker since 11 has his first wine at 4pm ( it's 5pm somewhere in the world! ).....lol still mentally more stable than me lol....my neighbour had lung cancer she never smoked...her daughter had leukaemia and died at 38!!! I think what I'm trying to say very badly our bodies are unique...certainly gather as much information as you can but it's about making a decision for me that in five/ten twenty years you can stand by.... Good luck and the info and knowledge on here is.fantastic  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Decisions to make, all so overwhelming

Posts.Content: Hi Ossy  I just wanted to send Rainbow hugs ..you should never feel ashamed ..whatever your treatment it's life changing ..I'm still coming to terms with the new me ...here is a great place to shout scream laugh and cry ..there's always someone to pick you up lol...I'm on the hope course ..completed two sessions and so far it's been excellent maybe you could ask at your coffee morning ...I've had loads of meltdowns and as my journey continues I look back and think omg what a fuss I made but at the time it was sooo important !! I frequently use fragrant heart.com the audios are free and it helps me to relax also sleep ..I used it last year after my knee replacement ( shit 12 months lol)..a fave movie to cry and laugh with is always good ...I think acceptance that you are having a shit few days ..it's ok ...don't be so hard on yourself we are all guilty of that on here ! You will come out of it ..it's part of the healing process  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi I did put up another comment that added to the moods as well lol.....we could have a Tom Facebook / twitter lol....I find that counting to ten slowly helps also....think is it worth stressing about that he's left the bloody wardrobe door open again!!! I now think I'm here to see that door open lol...it works 90% of the time!!! ....Tom you are naughty but a life saver  Rainbow Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ash  I'm just a bit behind you grade 3 op Jan 5th rads end of March ...if you are worried phone the bcn and go and see them ..even if it's just for piece of mind ...I went to see a breast reconstruction consultant a few weeks ago ...he was great in explaining just because your skin heals the radiotherapy works for months afterwards and my breast is still showing signs of that ..this was new to me !! My breast keeps changing and recently gone very tight again so am upping the exercises ...it's very hard and lumpy too ...I'm not worried as he warned me this will continue and I'm not considering surgery for at least 12 months when he said he would do it when I'm ready ..hope this helps  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: I had lumpectomy mid Dec 16 for DCIS grade 2 no lymph nodes involved...

Posts.Content: Only been on tamoxifen two months but so far slight aches and hot flushes but mood swings awful.....I take it an hour after my evening meal as recommended by bcn nurse and seems to be okay also which make is very important as the cheap generic ones its the infills that cause some of the side effects.....I insist on Wockhardt make ....before I walk I take a zapain and ibuprofen  Hope this helps  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Rome  I read your post with interest as I too am changing from tamoxifen to letrozole ..I am waiting for a blood test regarding magnesium levels as I've read that if low aches and pains can be bad ...I'm changing as I've gone from peri menopausal to post menopausal since February and had a DVT ...but no gap just straight onto letrozole ...my GP is great and he's prescribed femera as this is the best ..the pharmacist cannot swop it for a generic cheap version ..please don't worry about the bone density scan ..it takes about 20 mins and as long as you have no metal on you stay clothed..it's important to have a baseline before starting letrozole ...good luck with it all ...I am nervous about side effects myself  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen withdrawal

Posts.Content: Hi all I was on tamoxifen from Feb to June and changed to femera on the 14th June ...slight nausea at first but nothing else I also take glucosamine sulphate and a combined vit d and calcium twice a day .my vit d was dangerously low in Feb but now normal and my GP said just keep taking it as it will do you no harm ...if you have a good GP ( I'm very lucky as he's a Macmillans trained GP ) ask him to prescribe femera it's the original and by law the chemist has to get that for you . Letrozole is the generic name and the pharmacy will get the cheapest they can ...femera is £80-£100 per month whereas letrozole is £3/£4 per month ...kinda says it all !! My GP agrees with me that if I'm taking it for 10 years I want the best !! It's the fillers that cause the side effects and some stories are awful ...hope this helps  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Letrozole - side effects and supplements

Posts.Content: May I ask what happened as I am now waiting for my test results on the 6th Feb and hoping its low or high so no grey area...it's a very lonely journey even with lots of support
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Thanks. Glasgow I didn't know that about high grades which makes me wonder why they sent off for the test!  Good luck to you and everyone fighting this awful disease..... Xxx
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: You were one of the first people on here who messaged me and I remember you making me smile ( had not done for a while! ) when you said about your toyboy lol...... My son is in Perth until Sunday and played golf yesterday,he attended a wedding in Albany.....and you also make me want to visit Japan!!! Can I send you the bill lol!!  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Seroma update

Posts.Content: Hi  I get my oncotype dx results next Monday and the waiting is agony and I agree with everyone else that if it's in the 19-30 score what do I do?  I just hope the result is low but I also realise after reading many posts chemo affects people very differently....if you Google oncotype dx reports there are excellent sample reports to look at which has helped me to prepare for next Mondays meeting with my oncologist.....good luck xxxx
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Thanks Glasgow...As you say nearly there and to be honest the bcn said prepare for chemo and I think if I do then any other news will be a bonus....thanks for the info...there is a clinical trial called fast forward for radiotherapy..but until Monday its a guessing game...everyone on here is lovely and I'm so glad I've joined...deffo let you know the outcome on Monday and ill probably have loads of questions too!!! Xxx Actually that's silly  how do you prepare for chemo....its so hard
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi deffo normal I think it's like me the new normal ...this cancer journey is so emotionally draining at every stage .....i finished rt 30th March and still get tired although working full time now .....there is a good course called mindfulness and another which is called Hope ...on here you will get lots of support from fab ladies on here ...good luck  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Just wondering if I'm normal

Posts.Content: Just being honest, I think you are fab ....I'm afraid it's the other way round here...I'll send the toyboy round lol...he loves lamb and has to cook it himself lol....its daft really ...my daughter and I saved some lambs years ago from a main road and since then not touched it.....now give me a lovely sirloin yum yum!! lol lol  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Seroma update

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn It does sound like it's healing, slowly but surely. I know you are very knowledgeable and I've learnt so much from you...when mine burst and kept building up and being drained i started using my long handled body brush and it's really helped also with the severe cording in my arm and armpit  You are a shining star on here...thank you for sharing... Happy Easter... Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Seroma update

Posts.Content: It might be worth checking out knitted knockers uk ...it's a  fantastic charity ..good luck ..I had a wle.....but had a lot of shrinkage the knitted knocker helps balance everything and is so comfy and light  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Reconstruction and natural boob bra query

Posts.Content: What cream are you using ? its very tiring going every day  but ring that bell bloody loud when you've finished !!  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy club

Posts.Content: You are doing the right thing and as London lass said we are with you every step of the way ... Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Hi Narna Sorry that your friend is now in a club no one wants to join...but on here there are lots of fab ladies with a wealth of knowledge...I think you might be referring to the oncotype dx test....its not a drug its a test they do on the tumour ( 21 genes ) to see if chemotherapy is of any benefit.  The tumour is sent to California ( lucky tumour!!!) ...it takes two weeks which is a long long time and the score you get is based on the chances of recurring breast cancer...basically the lower the score the better. 0-18....no chemo ( side effects outway the benefit) 18-30....other factors are considered a grey area  30 + deffo to have chemo first  It's a 3 page detailed report which make sure she gets a copy  Good luck to her and how lucky to have a friend like you  Rainbow Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Hi. Question what do you know about omcotype dx please am asking if...

Posts.Content: Hi I was not prepared when getting my results through I would have to wait another two weeks as the tumour had just landed in California!! Lucky tumour!  Two weeks of googling talking with family and friends....on the day I had decided 18-24 they would really have to.sell chemo to me.....my score was my lucky nos 9 so not if I'd begged would they offer it as the side effects  far far outway the benefits..my nurse at my GP's had breast cancer 15 years ago and can't believe the improvements and individualised treatment  Two years ago I would on paper deffo have had chemo....both my surgeon bcn and oncologist had said 70/80% I would have chemo  One thing you've said is 25 plus deffo chemo and yet everything I'd read its 30 plus please check this.....having chemo would have given me an extra 0.03% no deal breaker for.me ....at the end of the day go with your gut feeling not the panicy one if you know what I mean.....I've now finished radiotherapy and suffering a little but is doable....if you'd like to know any thing more message me Oh and my nasty little critter was a grade 3 too..cancer starts this journey but YOU fnish it  Hugs and rainbows Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Apologies for the wrong name...Pootlecav......xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Morning Pootlecav  I can't express how much I feel for you and I understand that you want them to make the decision...what if they say no to chemo?  With or without chemo there is unfortunately no guarantee that it won't come back.....I personally wanted to take ownership of my journey  /treatments....we are all in a club that we don't want to be but life sucks sometimes...... As I've said some regardless of the score still want chemo and I understand......ask the team if it was their family member what would they say..... Cancer started this journey but you take control and finish it.....there's soooo much supoort on here for you too.....whatever decision you make...think in five/ten years would I do the same?  Whatever my future holds I can say yes....... Fate played a massive role in my diagnosis as I should not have got a letter sending me for a mammogram in November...I wasn't due till July 2018......we all say it's my mums divine intervention lol and it probably is.....just go with your gut feeling  Loads of hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Hi again  My advice is go out do something good with your partner/friends family without even mentioning the c word....I went to Anglesey the day after my result in February ....walked on the beach ( bloody freezing lol) but sunny.....saw a rainbow that day...I've  loved them since a child hence the name..... You will feel calmer....I wish there was a guarantee but there isn't and that's with or without chemo.....it sucks!  Fate deffo got me here....even on the day of my op my mums school was on BBC breakfast 2mins before I was called in for my guide wire....mums school is one of 320 in Liverpool!!! Goosebumps or what lol so did all the staff lol  There is no record of the letter being sent on my file......they were piloting 47-50 year olds ( I was 53 and already on the screening ) also WN postcodes I'm an L40 lol!!!  I think at the end of the day it's what we choose and how we want to move forward....who knows what's round the corner.....what I'm trying to say very badly.....once you've settled on your decision you will feel so much better.....look at the thread re radiotherapy its a great idea....big hugs to you and yours  Rainbow Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Morning Pootleclaw When you go for your results listen to everything they say ask them to go over it again.....have a list of questions......the reason rt is hardly mentioned that in some states a score of 0-10....woman are given hormonal treatment and no rt......its a minefield but as I've said with my lucky 9 there was no choice....those in the grey area I feel for....if you want more time to go away and discuss more if they are good they will encourage you to do so......its early days for me but I'm more than happy with my choices and that's how you should feel. My friend had triple negative at 35....had chemo rt the works and 3 weeks before her 5 year clear the little bugger had attached to her scarring....ending with a mastectomy which she wish she had originally but we are all great with hindsight...she's clear again and doing well.. I think what I'm  trying to say, very badly. Lol.that some want to blast the nasty bugger with everything regardless of the improved tests etc and that is absolutely the right thing for them....for me researching and listening was enough and I know I've said this but if it was 18-24 my answer was still no.... Write in your journal how you feel and the pros and cons...it helps  Lots of hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Just wanted to wish you all the luck and look to the future ..by this time tomorrow you are on the road to recovery ..small steps ...all here for you  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Big op tomorrow!

Posts.Content: I have read all your posts and followed your journey.....I agree with Lynn get out there...have fun...don't let the petty things annoy you....so pleased the light is starting to shine more brightly.....follow your personal rainbow and set your chakras when having your massage...I have 9 rt treatments to go and just started itching!!! But it's going quickly...I am like you worried for the future but who knows live each day positively  Keep in touch  Rainbows and dragonflies make me smile  Debs xxx  Dragonflies are survivors and very naughty in their early life in the water!!!  LOL
Posts.Title: Appointments and courses x

Posts.Content: Hi  I've been on tamoxifen and now on letrozole but I had a long chat with my GP and said if I had to take a pill for 10 years I want the best ! Femara costs £80-£100 a month and letrozole generics £2-£4 a month kind of speaks for itself !! I also take glucosamine sulphate and so far im good just stiff if I sit too long but that was happenning after my knee replacement anyway ...the trouble is we blame the cancer for every ache every pain etc ...give it a go ..I've decided to give it two years and then I'll reconsider  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: stopping letrozol

Posts.Content: Mad head London Lass...love it ...Happy Bank Holiday xxxx Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxx
Posts.Title: its the weekend ;-)

Posts.Content: Hi Optomistic i was grade 3 and no nodes ..the 3 was a massive shock ...and I know how you feel 90% of the time I'm good and then ...it's like a wave of doubt comes flooding in along with "Tom" (tamoxifen)....I feel like screaming inside "why me ? " I realise that you want the old you but I've decided instead of mourning the old me I'm going to invest in the new me ...me and my parther wrote what we both want to do some silly some mad things and we've called it our F*** it list lol ...each day is a plus it's hard and I don't always think that but we are all entitled to our off days warm hugs and beautiful rainbows sent to you  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Dealing with uncertainty

Posts.Content: Diagnosed 7th December ...7 hospitals later ...3 counties.....fallen into a black hole ...under Christies and Clattterbridge but neither wanted to lead ...Pals involvement ....horrific journey and even yesterday about to travel over an hour away to see a bcn but managed to get in at thomas linacre centre in wigan.....only to be told today for the first time that there is a.bcn based at southport and ormskirk !!! omg....sooo annoyed andfrustrated....bloody great when felt sooo isolated and now when I'm at the end of treatment No communication whatsoever!!! Rant over ta for reading  I need a rainbow  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: I NEED A RANT !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Helen  Thank you and just poured a glass of cava...I'm a cava girl since going to Barcelona over Xmas and being proposed to on Christmas Day!!! LOL thank you for the support xxx
Posts.Title: I NEED A RANT !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Tox  Love the pic...hugs are always good can never have enough  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: I NEED A RANT !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi PictureMish Thanks for the advice I'm on the move forward programme at Ormskirk...just having a break as problems with certain area of the breast with burns....I'm more upset and annoyed that if I'd chosen st Helens then I would have had a local bcn.....just lack of communication right from November has eventually got to me!!!  Thanks again  Rainbow Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: I NEED A RANT !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Has anyone had any luck getting on the course ? If it helps I can look next week if anyone wants o give me a location they are in ...just the area doesn't have to be precise ...I will be with Macmillan on Monday to discuss the problems of the course filtering through ...just want to help  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: It was a manager for information support that found the course for me but it's not filtering down as I'm sure a lot of people would like to do the course ...the one I went on they had to cancel as they couldn't get 6 people on it but I think it's because not many people know about it ...you could phone Macmillan and ask who is your regional manager and give them a ring ...I live in West Lancs and it was either Bolton in June or Hoylake in Octobef both nearly an hours drive but now I'm so glad I attended ..hopefully more will be trained to facilitate the course ..hope this helps  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone  I just wanted to post that I completed the Hope Course on Monday ...it's a six week course attending one day a week for 2 and a half hours ...you meet others who have had or going through their own cancer journey ..the course is run by Macmillan and I'd just like to say if you get the opportunity to go on it ...it's bloody brilliant ...I'm much more positive and have made new friends too ...I had to drive nearly an hour as that was where the nearest course to me was but sooo worth it  Positive thoughts  Rainbow Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hi Peggysgirl  Yes deffo agree the more support the better...and although I'm very lucky and have a very supportive fiancé kids and friends there is only so much they understand and want to hear ...so being with others who had their own journeys to tell and we quickly formed a bond and moved forward together each week ...more staff are being trained and there is a facilitator from Macmillan and also someone who has had cancer who runs the course  ...hope you get on one soon  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Oops lol I meant the one that had to cancel was in November ...it runs with a minimum of 6  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hope High School  Skelmersdale West Lancs 10am -Noon Friday 29th September  I've organised the coffee morning and  invited the community by doing leaflet drops, posters in the local college and Asda and the pubs lol !! I'm just not sure how it will go either loads of people or loads of cake left lol ...because I'm cheeky I've managed to get a local florist to donate centre pieces for the tables ...ALSO  The new Macmillan Information Centre is being officially opened in the concourse Skelmersdale from 2pm -4pm ...so it's a dash after the coffee morning to set up there ...I'm very honoured as I was asked a while ago to be their Patient Ambassador ( I get to wear a very green sash !!) press attending both  ANYONE IN THE AREA IS VERY WELCOME TO ATTEND EITHER OR BOTH !!!
Posts.Title: Worlds Biggest Coffee Morning

Posts.Content: Hi Winky49 I'm on a strong antihistamine unrelated to cancer diagnosis ..since 2012 ...get them from your GP mine are Telfast fexofenadine (180mg) I take one in the morning and havnt missed one ..I never had any itchiness after op or during radiotherapy although I'm now on femara ( letrozole ) I was on tamoxifen and there is no issue taking it ...the ones over the counter are only 5/10 mg lol !!! I've mentioned the make as I once had cheap generic ones that gave me terrible indigestion...hope this is helpful  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: itchy breast

Posts.Content: Have a great holiday ...make sure you move around on the flight X
Posts.Title: itchy breast

Posts.Content: Dear dear LondonLass ...you are deffo allowed a shitty tearful day ...but you are a fighter so tomorrow is another day.....I've just come in from the garden watching the blue tits in and out of the box ...beautiful sunshine ☀️...we are still here !! you have sent so many supportive messages to me ans sooo many others ...how can I help ? im sad today as I've found out what my friend died of and it could have been easily avoided ....sending to you  Hugs and more hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Feelings.......

Posts.Content: I worked through rt but have not had chemo so it's different for  me...when you go for your planning meeting insist that your appointments are the same each day to give your skin 24 hours rest...my first was at 5.15pm whichalways takes longer then my other 18 where at 3pm....I would leave school at 2pm....one down side is you wait....with hindsight am is better as no chance of falling behind but for me I didn't then want to go to work!!  Get your R1 and R2....my skin was great until 15th treatment.....I have some burn but more of a problem with my nipple but it's bareble. Remember work has to make reasonable adjustments for you....I had extra breaks  Oh and the tattoos at planning are choice not what I was told !!!! Hope this helps  Hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx good luck xxx
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Teresa I'm so sorry for your loss they are a part of the family for so long.....I had horses when I was younger...they are good for the soul......you just have to remember the lovely times you had....please don't over do it I know we all do but in the long run its not worth it...great news re the score.....checkout the radiotherapy thread loads of advice and my rants lol....ive suffered with fatigue since end of radiotherapy but I worked throughout which at the time seemed like a good idea!!!  Give yourself plenty of ordering time it could be just a local thing but the pharmacist tried to fob me off with generic crap even after the gp had put on the specific brand!!! It's down to money.....strangely after creating three days later my prescription was in lol  We battle for  everything ...Hooe your gp is good and gets you R1 and R2 its worth it...have a lovely day my puppy is 2 today I have mum and daughter ( Gracie and Pebbles ) meeting up with her 4 other pups at the pub later...probably get chucked out lol  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Starting tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi...firstly I hope you are less stressed today and enjoy the bank holiday... I started in February and take mine an hour after tea..with tea juice and very naughty sometimes cava!!!  Lots of different advice and I think it's whatever suits you...so far some aches and a few hot flushes ( was getting them anyway ) so good so far...am seeing oncologist for check up Thursday...I know some have 10mg tabs and take am/pm...its vital to have a good make that suits you..I'm on wockhardt  Ask anything you want on here..nothing is ever too silly if it worries you..I did lol..good luck  Hugs and rainbows Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Starting tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Just wanted to add all the best and good luck to you both ....keep up with the exercise its very important  It's okay to have bad days makes the good ones extra special Extra hugs and rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Panic setting in before operation

Posts.Content: Morning amber tiger  Sorry to hear of your distress and hope you get it sorted today ...I take telfast fexofenadine (180mg) once a day antihistamine...unrelated to diagnosis of cancer ..I'm afraid I can't help you re your op but I never had any itchiness with the healing or during radiotherapy ...it might be worth getting from your GP ...over the counter are only 5/10 mg ....let us know how you get on  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Post surgery advice

Posts.Content: Firstly typical GP comment ! Makes me cross ...we should all have good quality of life and hair loss is a worry to most ...I was on tamoxifen from Feb to June then changed to femara ..deffo noticed thinning ..I'm lucky my hair is fine but lots of it but as you've said comes out in clumps when washing and brushing ...I also take d3 and calcium as my vitD was low in February ..I also take phosamine sulphate which helps with the joints ...have you had a bone density scan ? This is a must so they have a baseline of how healthy your bones are on starting treatment ..I'm going to see my GP in next two weeks if he suggests anything I'll post it on here  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xx
Posts.Title: Letrozole -hair loss

Posts.Content: After delaying the operation  and going to.Barcelona for Christmas...getting engaged!!!! Third time lucky...!!! on Christmas Day...I was so ready!!! It's fine it gets rid of the critter....I'd had a knee replacement last June so the pain did nor compare  Hugs and Rainbows  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Panic setting in before operation

Posts.Content: I just wanted to say hi and how lucky that your aunt is to have you ...I did not have a mastectomy so cannot give advice but there will be somebody along that will ..the support and advice and knowledge on here is superb ...it maybe a little quiet at the weekend ... Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Care after Surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Laura  I was in a similar position diagnosed 7/1216...initially after biopsy given grade 2 early screen detected invasive breast cancer...lots of Doctors are moving away from staging....my partner. ( now my fiance! ) had booked Barcelona in September for Christmas...what a dilemma...every single person said go for it...my mind was all over the place but they said it would make no difference and mentally it would do me good.....they were absolutely bloody right!!! LOL.....Chris proposed on Christmas Day (he had  planned for ages! ) we had a fab time....it was exactly what we needed.....it becomes 24/7 and quickly takes over if you allow it.....someone has mentioned the oncotype dx test...I was unprepared when getting the results on the 23rd of January that I would have to wait another two weeks to see what my treatment would be.....knowledge gives you strength....all the best advice you will get from all the wonderful people on here...all members of a club we don't want to be in !!! I was er+pr+her negative...node negative ( 3 sentinel 10 nodes ) removed...we all have different amount of sentinel nodes!  Down side grade 3 (nasty bugger! ) ....but oncotype dx score was low ( my lucky nos 9) ...so am about to start week three of radiotherapy...I have done ten out of 19....lots of advice about skin care on here too....the waiting is the very worse thing and that's what's made me ill more than the treatments...talk openly laugh and cry together go on that fantastic holiday and enjoy with your mum.....and family.....insurance I phoned Barclays up and as long as I wasn't travelling against doctors orders they were actually very good  Hope this helps....follow your rainbow  Debs xx( oh and I'm 54 !) xxxx
Posts.Title: Mom diagnosed with invasive lobular breast cancer

Posts.Content: If you search radiotherapy club there is lots of great advice ...I'm a great support of R1and R2 you should be able to get it free on prescription from your GP ...please remember for months after the radiotherapy is still active within your breast/armpit etc so changes still occur ...they tell you about the skin etc but it was only when I saw the plastic surgeon about reconstruction for next year he mentioned it ..no one connected with rt did !!!  Good luck  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxx
Posts.Title: My radiotherapy experience

Posts.Content: Not sure this is helpful.....but I would recommend yearly only because I had my screening July 2015...everything good then I got a letter in November 2016 out of the blue with an appointment...my puppy chewed it lol so I had to phone up and if the girl had said I'll cancel it...I would have said "no probs".....thank god she didn't...as I had no symptoms and was diagnosed with invasive breast cancer on 7th December 2016.......all my family and friends and the bcn's are convinced its divine intervention from my mum!!!!! So I will deffo be having a yearly screening......my worry on this journey has always been about getting my head around having breast cancer and not knowing and then the bloody treatments afterwards have near killed me twice!!! It's like our cancer journeys they are all so personal and individual.....my best wishes to all  Hugs and Rainbows Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Mammo 50

Posts.Content: Hey you ..how are you doing ? I'm 8 fractions in and totally pissed off with it ...I've worked out that if it continues I'll be waiting 17 hours for 3 hours and 40 mins of treatment !!!!  I'm sooo going to do something g about this lol x Rainbows make me smile xxx Debs xxx
Posts.Title: MRI machine broke got to wait another month

Posts.Content: You can refuse to have the tattoos which they don't tell you...I now wish I had...yes only tiny but one that I hate is in the middle of my cleavage....hate it....I've met a lady who refused and although they were funny with her it can be.done without....I was not given that choice which has greatly upset me....just thought you can have that choice....I'm 10 treatments in of 19 Good luck  Rainbow Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy planning appointment

Posts.Content: Hi Emma  Deep breaths ... I had no symptoms and was screen detected ...they will be able to distinguish very quickly if it's a suspicious looking lump ..I'm gathering by the 76 it's your date of birth ?  I agree with Sal ..being prepared for the worse anything else is good !!  If it is cancer ..this is very treatable ...stay positive I know it's hard  Never give up ..never give in  Hugs and Rainbows  All here for you  Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Test day today!
